body:
I agree that it would have been nice, but unfortunately nesting `select`s doesn't quite work out well (https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/1623). Fortunately, in this case, we can avoid the need to nest.

@karllessard : `-z defs` doesn't work on all platforms (the linker in OS X for example). How about we leave the set empty for debug builds. So, add `"//tensorflow:debug": [],` as the first condition in the `select` statement here so that for debug builds we don't do any custom linker configuration.
body_html:
I agree that it would have been nice, but unfortunately nesting selects doesn't quite work out well (bazelbuild/bazel#1623). Fortunately, in this case, we can avoid the need to nest.

@karllessard : -z defs doesn't work on all platforms (the linker in OS X for example). How about we leave the set empty for debug builds. So, add "//tensorflow:debug": [], as the first condition in the select statement here so that for debug builds we don't do any custom linker configuration.
body_text:
I agree that it would have been nice, but unfortunately nesting selects doesn't quite work out well (bazelbuild/bazel#1623). Fortunately, in this case, we can avoid the need to nest.
@karllessard : -z defs doesn't work on all platforms (the linker in OS X for example). How about we leave the set empty for debug builds. So, add "//tensorflow:debug": [], as the first condition in the select statement here so that for debug builds we don't do any custom linker configuration.
